item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by William Gibson
item.description:
"The future is already here â€“ it's just not evenly distributed.
<i>The Economist, December 4, 2003</i>" -- William Gibson

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel." -- William Gibson

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Life would be unbearably dull if we had answers to all our questions." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Jonathan Ames
item.description: "I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained." -- Jonathan Ames

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Phyllis McGinley
item.description: "A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet." -- Phyllis McGinley

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "I suspect the truth is that we are waiting, all of us, against insurmountable odds, for something extraordinary to happen to us." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?" -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Neil Jordan
item.description: "Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?" -- Neil Jordan

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Henry Adams
item.description: "Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit." -- Henry Adams

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "I don't think life is absurd. I think we are all here for a huge purpose. I think we shrink from the immensity of the purpose we are here for." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Karen Blixen
item.description: "I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea." -- Karen Blixen

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Nellie Bly
item.description: "Energy rightly applied and directed will accomplish anything." -- Nellie Bly

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Rabindranath Tagore
item.description: "Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky." -- Rabindranath Tagore

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Alexander Pushkin
item.description: "I want to understand you, I study your obscure language." -- Alexander Pushkin

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Alice McDermott
item.description: "We are surrounded by story." -- Alice McDermott

item.title: Matriarchy add a quote by Margaret Drabble
item.description: "Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it." -- Margaret Drabble
